bugs.title: CVE-2024-7024 chromium: V8 Sandbox Bypass: wasm function signature confusion leading to out of sandbox arbitrary read/write [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-7024 chromium: V8 Sandbox Bypass: wasm function signature confusion leading to out of sandbox arbitrary read/write [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-7024 chromium-browser: V8 Sandbox Bypass: wasm function signature confusion leading to out of sandbox arbitrary read/write

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 126.0.6478.54 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314347

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-7022 chromium: out of bounds memory access [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-7022 chromium: out of bounds memory access [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-7022 chromium-browser: out of bounds memory access

long_desc.thetext: Uninitialized Use in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.58 allowed a remote attacker to perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314342

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-7020 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill in Google Chrome

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314341

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-7019 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in UI in Google Chrome [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-7019 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in UI in Google Chrome [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-7019 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in UI in Google Chrome

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in UI in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314340

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-7018 chromium: Heap buffer overflow in PDF in Google Chrome [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-7018 chromium: Heap buffer overflow in PDF in Google Chrome [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-7018 chromium-browser: Heap buffer overflow in PDF in Google Chrome

long_desc.thetext: Heap buffer overflow in PDF in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.78 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted PDF file. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314339

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-7282 chromium: domain spoofing in google chrome [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-7282 chromium: domain spoofing in google chrome [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-7282 chromium-browser: domain spoofing in google chrome

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to 113.0.5672.63 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform domain spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2314338

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
